result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Prosecutor.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver filed by Atty Jason Lockery

Atty Lockery has not yet received a copy of the Information.
As long as the information mirrors the complaint Atty Locker wishes to go to arraignment.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:08 PM Defendant Rosalyn A Stepp in court.  Attorney Jason Matthew Lockery in court for Rosalyn A Stepp.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22TR1564 is tracking with 22CF342.

Court calls the case and states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty Jason Lockery appointed

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rosalyn A Stepp in court. 
Court questions if the defendant has contacted the public defender office.
Defendant stated she did but has not heard from them yet.
Court informs the defendant to contact the public defender.
Matter is rescheduled.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report filed by Atty Kate Frigo Drury
Pretrial Supervision Status Report from JusticePoint dated 07/21/22
Initial Appearance set for July 25, 2022 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 3

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within the scope of your employment. 
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting for participation in the Pre-Trial Supervision program.

1:43 PM Defendant Rosalyn A Stepp appeared by video, in custody from the Portage County jail.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Rosalyn A Stepp. 

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Operating While Intoxicated. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Atty Soule states the defendant is eligible for public defender representation.

State requests a $2,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Court questions Atty Mutchler. 
Atty Mutchler responds. 
Atty Soule makes bond arguments to the court.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
